description.text: this message file contains message for [name] package

msg.text: Input pin DDRCLKPOL of input DDR component $$s for port $$s is not driven by a DQSBUF component.
Input pin ECLKDQSR of input DDR component $$s for port $$s is not connected.
Input pin ECLKDQSR of input DDR component $$s for port $$s is not driven by the $$s($$s) component.
Input pin DDRLAT of input DDR component $$s for port $$s is not connected.
Input pin DDRLAT of input DDR component $$s for port $$s is not driven by the $$s($$s) component.
ODDRXD component $$s cannot be used with tristate DDR component $$s for port $$s. Must use a OFD1S3AX component.
ODDRXD component $$s cannot be used with tristate register $$s for port $$s. Must use a OFD1S3AX component.

The 'IDDRAPPS' property is missing on IDDR instance '$$s'. Each IDDR component targeted for this device needs the 'IDDRAPPS' property that identifies the interface being implemented. Refer to DDR usage documentation for details. \n
SCLK is not used for component $$s that has interface type of $$s. This interface type requires SCLK connection.\n

The 'ODDRAPPS' property is missing on ODDR instance '$$s'. Each ODDR component targeted for this device needs the 'ODDRAPPS' property that identifies the interface being implemented. Refer to DDR usage documentation for details. \n
The $$s APPS property value '$$s' on $$s instance '$$s' is invalid. \n
DDR DQ port $$s (IOBUF $$s) is using IO_TYPE $$s. DDR DQ ports must use SSTL25_I or SSTL25_II types.
DDR DQS port $$s (IOBUF $$s) is using IO_TYPE $$s. DDR DQS ports must use SSTL25_I or SSTL25_II types.
DDR DQ port $$s (IOBUF $$s) is using IO_TYPE $$s. DDR DQ ports must use SSTL18_I or SSTL18_II types.
DDR DQS port $$s (IOBUF $$s) is using IO_TYPE $$s. DDR DQS ports must use SSTL18_I, SSTL18_II, or SSTL18D_II types.
DDR DQ port $$s (IOBUF $$s) is using IO_TYPE $$s. DDR DQ ports must use SSTL15 type.
DDR DQS port $$s (IOBUF $$s) is using IO_TYPE $$s. DDR DQS ports must use SSTL15D type.
Cannot use $$s component '$$s' with IDDR instance '$$s' configured as part of a memory interface. Need to use bypass mode.\n
The design has $$d error(s) related to DDR component(s).
EQ_CAL=$$s is not a valid value for PIO buffer '$$s' on port $$s with IO_TYPE '$$s'. EQ_CAL will be set to 0.\n
